titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Mathematician and historian Alice Bache Gould graduated from Bryn Mawr College in 1889, receiving her bachelor's degree in Mathematics and Physics. She continued her study of mathematics at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and Newham College in England from 1890-1893. In 1911 Gould traveled to Spain to do research on Christopher Columbus. During World War I Gould worked as a volunteer in the espionage office of the United States embassy in Spain. After the war Gould returned to the United States to teach. In 1926 Gould again returned to Spain to continue her research on Columbus and became involved in public education measures and the establishment of local schools in Simancas. The outbreak of the Spanish Civil War in 1936 forced her to return to Boston but after the war she returned to Spain. She lived the remainder of her life in Simancas, where she died in 1953.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers by and about Alice Bache Gould collected by her cousin and the executor of her will, Susan W. Fitzgerald. Correspondence from Alice Bache Gould includes requests for donations to the Paul Shorey Chair endowment, and letters to her cousin Susan Fitzgerald about her move back to Spain after Spanish Civil War and about the disposition of her estate. Other materials in the collection include letters to Gould from Henry Goldmark and letters to Fitzgerald about the assembly of the present set of papers.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University: Alice Bache Gould Papers; Massachusetts Historical Society: Alice Bache Gould papers.
